modules.description: This module defines a decision type used during the traversal of S-expression files to control whether to break, continue, or skip processing at each node. It works with S-expressions, guiding how a rewriter processes nested structures or skips specific elements. Concrete use cases include selectively rewriting or linting parts of Dune files while preserving the structure of the remaining expressions.

This module maps positions and ranges from parsed S-expressions to source file locations. It transforms `Parsexp.Positions.range` values into `Loc.t` and `Loc.Range.t` representations, enabling precise error reporting and file rewriting. Useful when linting or modifying `.dune` files, where accurate location tracking is necessary for transformations and diagnostics.

Handles the parsing and rewriting of S-expression files by exposing the internal parsed values and positions. Works directly with `Parsexp.Many_and_positions.parsed_value` to enable custom transformations based on the structured representation of S-expressions. Useful for implementing linting rules or automated refactoring tools that require precise manipulation of dune file contents.

This module defines a data structure for representing parsing errors in S-expression files, including the location and message of each error. It provides functions to create and format these error instances specifically for use in linting and rewriting workflows. Concrete use cases include reporting malformed syntax or invalid constructs during automated dune file analysis.

This module processes and rewrites S-expression files, primarily for automated linting and refactoring of Dune files in large codebases. It provides structured access to parsed S-expressions, tracks their positions, and allows selective transformations using visitor functions that can skip or modify specific nodes. Key operations include parsing with error handling, visiting and rewriting expressions with positional awareness, and generating updated file contents while preserving original structure and formatting.
